provider.specialty: Not documented — GI on consult per notes

service.rationale: Initiation of biologic therapy for moderate-to-severe Crohn's disease refractory to corticosteroid therapy

clinical.diagnosis: Crohn's disease (IBD) — ileal and colonic involvement with strictures, cobblestoning, aphthous ulcers
clinical.icd_10_code: K50.80 (inferred — Crohn's disease of both small and large intestine, without complications). Consider K50.811 (with rectal bleeding) given hematochezia.
clinical.prior_treatments_and_results: Methylprednisolone 40mg daily — currently failing. Patient has ongoing hematochezia (x3 episodes overnight), abdominal cramping, and worsening anemia (Hgb 9.0) requiring pRBC transfusion.
clinical.specific_drugs_taken_and_failures: Methylprednisolone 40mg daily — inadequate response (continued bloody stools, pain, anemia despite therapy)
clinical.alternative_drugs_required: Per Cigna policy Section 2.A.ii: Patient must have tried or be currently taking corticosteroids, OR tried one other conventional systemic therapy. Patient meets criterion (a) — currently on corticosteroids.

relevant_lab_results_or_imaging.cbc: Hgb 9.0 (LOW), Hct 32% (LOW), RBC 3.5 (LOW), MCV 78 (LOW — microcytic), Platelets 450k (HIGH — reactive), WBC 12k (normal for age)
relevant_lab_results_or_imaging.inflammatory_markers: ESR 30 (HIGH, ref <20), CRP 25 (HIGH, ref <5), Fecal Calprotectin 150 (HIGH, ref <50), Fecal Occult Blood POSITIVE
relevant_lab_results_or_imaging.iron_panel: Ferritin 15 (low-normal), Iron 40 (LOW), TIBC 450 (HIGH) — iron deficiency pattern
relevant_lab_results_or_imaging.cmp: Within normal limits (glucose, BUN, creatinine, electrolytes, liver function all normal)
relevant_lab_results_or_imaging.egd: Gastritis with erythema, mild-to-moderate duodenitis with edema. Biopsies pending.
relevant_lab_results_or_imaging.colonoscopy: Ileum: patchy inflammation, erythema, ulceration, segmental strictures. Colon: diffuse inflammation, cobblestone appearance, multiple aphthous ulcers with skip areas, granularity and friability. Rectum: mild inflammation. Biopsies pending.

clinical.symptom_severity_and_impact: Multiple episodes of abdominal cramping and hematochezia (x3 overnight), poor sleep, pallor, fatigue, dizziness, tachycardia (HR 110). Symptomatic anemia requiring transfusion.
clinical.prognosis_and_risk_if_not_approved: Without biologic therapy, patient at risk for continued GI bleeding, worsening anemia requiring repeated transfusions, bowel stricture progression potentially requiring surgery, growth failure, and malnutrition in this pediatric patient.
clinical.clinical_rationale_for_urgency: Patient is actively symptomatic with hemodynamically significant anemia (HR 110, Hgb 9.0) requiring transfusion. Steroid therapy is failing. Biologic initiation is time-sensitive to prevent disease progression and surgical intervention.

extraction_confidence.notes: Patient and physician info severely limited by blank PA form. Clinical documentation from notes, labs, and imaging is comprehensive.

policy.policy_title: Inflammatory Conditions – Adalimumab Products Prior Authorization Policy
covered_indications: Crohn's disease in patients ≥ 6 years of age
Patient has tried/is currently taking corticosteroids OR corticosteroids are contraindicated
OR patient has tried one other conventional systemic therapy (azathioprine, 6-MP, methotrexate)
OR patient has tried at least one other biologic
Prescribed by or in consultation with a gastroenterologist

evidence: Patient DOB 10/19/2014, currently 10 years old per progress note header

criteria_evaluation.criterion: 2.A.ii — Patient meets ONE of (a, b, c, d): (a) has tried or is currently taking corticosteroids
evidence: Currently on Methylprednisolone 40mg daily per progress note Plan section
Continued hematochezia, abdominal pain, and anemia despite steroid therapy — documented failure of current corticosteroid treatment
criteria_evaluation.notes: Patient clearly meets criterion (a) — currently taking corticosteroids with inadequate response

criteria_evaluation.criterion: 2.A.iii — Medication prescribed by or in consultation with a gastroenterologist
evidence: Notes state: 'Gastroenterology on consult, appreciate recommendations'
PA form is blank — no prescribing physician specialty documented
criteria_evaluation.notes: GI is involved as a consult, which should satisfy 'in consultation with a gastroenterologist.' However, the PA form lacks any prescribing physician identification. A formal GI recommendation for adalimumab initiation would strengthen this criterion.

recommendation.rationale: Clinical evidence strongly supports medical necessity for adalimumab in this 10-year-old with moderate-to-severe Crohn's disease failing corticosteroid therapy. However, the PA form is entirely blank (no provider info, no NPI, no patient demographics, no medication details). Provider verification cannot be completed. Overall confidence 53.8% falls below the 60% threshold required for approval.
gaps: PA form is completely blank — all required fields must be completed

Medication name, strength, and dosing schedule not specified on PA form
